document.heading: Fiscal Year 2025 Revised Local Budget Adjustment Emergency Act of 2025
To adjust, on an emergency basis, certain allocations in the Fiscal Year 2025 Local Budget Act of 2024.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Fiscal Year 2025 Revised Local Budget Adjustment Emergency Act of 2025".

para.text: Pursuant to the Full-Year Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2025, approved March 15, 2025 (Pub. L. No. 119-4; 139 Stat. 9), and D.C. Official Code § 47-369.02, the appropriations set forth in the Fiscal Year 2025 Local Budget Act of 2024, effective September 18, 2024 (D.C. Law 25-218; 71 DCR 8366), are decreased by ($236,858,618) (including ($321,471,895) rescinded from local funds, $7,672,983 added to dedicated taxes, ($13,477,130) rescinded from Medicaid payments, $133,474,998 added to other funds, ($1,829,049) rescinded from enterprise and other funds, and ($41,228,524) rescinded from enterprise and other funds – dedicated taxes).
The adjustments made by subsection (a) of this section are allocated as follows:

The appropriation for Governmental Direction and Support is decreased by ($9,440,941) (including ($14,091,426) rescinded from local funds and $4,650,485 added to other funds), to be allocated as follows:
Board of Election: ($351,606) is rescinded from local funds;
Board of Ethics and Accountability: ($42,630) is rescinded from local funds;
Contract Appeals Board: ($29,340) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of General Services: $6,064,619 is added (including $2,564,619 added to local funds and $3,500,000 added to other funds);
Department of Human Resources: ($636,139) is rescinded (including ($371,772) rescinded from local funds and ($264,367) rescinded from other funds);
Employees' Compensation Fund: ($29,789) is rescinded from local funds;
Executive Office of the Mayor: $590,000 is added to local funds;
Mayor's Office of Legal Counsel: ($117,186) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Campaign Finance: ($1,556,796) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Contracting and Procurement: ($452,711) is rescinded (including ($2,465,286) rescinded from local funds and $2,012,575 added to other funds);
Office for the Deaf, Deafblind, and Hard of Hearing: ($34,440) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Disability Rights: ($107,297) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Employee Appeals: ($151,626) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Finance and Resource Management: ($150,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Labor Relations and Collective Bargaining: ($582,594) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, and Questioning Affairs: ($10,000) is rescinded from other funds;
Office of Risk Management: ($93,545) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Attorney General: ($1,988,327) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Chief Financial Officer: ($2,000,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Chief Technology Officer: ($2,562,145) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the City Administrator: ($2,057,551) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Inspector General: ($2,445,992) is rescinded (including ($1,858,269) rescinded from local funds and ($587,723) rescinded from other funds);
Office of the Secretary: ($118,100) is rescinded from local funds;
Office on Asian and Pacific Islander Affairs: ($192,965) is rescinded from local funds;
Office on Latino Affairs: ($258,976) is rescinded from local funds;
Public Employee Relations Board: ($178,465) is rescinded from local funds; and
Tax Revision Commission: $52,660 is added to local funds.

The appropriation for Economic Development and Regulation is decreased by ($34,728,240) (including ($32,804,447) rescinded from local funds, ($1,193,154) rescinded from dedicated taxes, and ($730,639) rescinded from other funds), to be allocated as follows:
Commission on the Arts and Humanities: ($881,154) is rescinded from dedicated taxes;
Department of Housing and Community Development: ($5,118,672) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Small and Local Business Development: ($1,321,472) is rescinded (including ($1,009,472) rescinded from local funds and ($312,000) rescinded from dedicates taxes);
Housing Production Trust Fund Subsidy: ($21,000,000) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Cable Television, Film, Music, and Entertainment: ($1,359,081) is rescinded (including ($922,875) rescinded from local funds and ($436,206) rescinded from other funds);
Office of Planning: ($168,114) is rescinded (including ($155,076) rescinded from local funds and ($13,038) rescinded from other funds);
Office of the Deputy Mayor for Planning and Economic Development: ($4,499,165) is rescinded (including ($4,276,564) rescinded from local funds and ($222,601) rescinded from other funds);
Office of the Tenant Advocate: ($163,247) is rescinded (including ($104,453) rescinded from local funds and ($58,794) rescinded from other funds);
Office of Zoning: ($181,837) is rescinded from local funds;
Real Property Tax Appeals Commission: ($26,640) is rescinded from local funds; and
Rental Housing Commission: ($8,860) is rescinded from local funds.
The appropriation for Public Safety and Justice is increased by $30,171,940 (including ($129,579,471) rescinded from local funds and $159,751,411 added to other funds), to be allocated as follows:
Corrections Information Council: ($168,576) is rescinded from local funds;
Criminal Code Reform Commission: ($151,942) is rescinded from local funds;
Criminal Justice Coordinating Council: ($240,483) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Corrections: $12,227,432 is added to local funds;
Department of Forensic Sciences: ($553,602) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Youth Rehabilitation Services: $11,780,952 is added to local funds;
District of Columbia National Guard: ($36,818) is rescinded from local funds;
District of Columbia Sentencing Commission: ($187,609) is rescinded from local funds;
Fire and Emergency Medical Services: ($0) is rescinded (including ($152,300,000) rescinded from local funds and $152,300,000 added to other funds);
Metropolitan Police Department: $19,486,493 is added to local funds;
Office of Administrative Hearings: ($39,148) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Human Rights: ($1,206,623) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement: ($3,187,652) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Police Complaints: ($236,953) is rescinded from local funds;
Office on Returning Citizens Affairs: ($509,007) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Chief Medical Examiner: ($53,766) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the Deputy Mayor for Public Safety and Justice: ($3,411,938) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of Unified Communications: ($897,339) is rescinded (including ($8,348,750) rescinded from local funds and $7,451,411 added to other funds); and
Office of Victim Services and Justice Grants: ($2,441,481) is rescinded from local funds.
The appropriation for Public Education System is increased by $8,049,876 (including $8,161,509 added to local funds and ($111,633) rescinded from other funds), to be allocated as follows:
Department of Employment Services: ($1,193,359) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Parks and Recreation: ($5,308,220) is rescinded (including ($5,228,661) rescinded from local funds and ($19,559) rescinded from other funds);
District of Columbia Public Library: ($308,598) is rescinded (including ($231,525) rescinded from local funds and ($77,073) rescinded from other funds);
District of Columbia Public Schools: ($415,326) is rescinded from local funds;
Non-Public Tuition: $8,000,000 is added to local funds;
Office of the Deputy Mayor for Education: ($935,300) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the State Superintendent of Education: ($6,769,009) is rescinded (including ($6,754,009) rescinded from local funds and ($15,000) rescinded from other funds);
Special Education Transportation: $17,070,000 is added to local funds;
State Board of Education: ($47,273) is rescinded from local funds; and
University of the District of Columbia Subsidy Account: ($2,043,049) is rescinded from local funds.

The appropriation for Human Support Services is increased by $30,877,048 (including $34,684,130 added to local funds, $8,917,082 added to dedicated taxes, ($13,477,130) rescinded from Medicaid payments, and $752,966 added to other funds), to be allocated as follows:
Child and Family Services Agency: ($4,177,747) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Aging and Community Living: ($508,935) is rescinded from local funds;
Department of Behavioral Health: $3,091,780 is added (including ($350,116) rescinded from local funds and $3,441,896 added to other funds);
Department of Health: $249,341 is added (including $1,296,409 added to local funds and ($1,047,068) rescinded from other funds);

Department of Health Care Finance: ($19,264,439) is rescinded (including ($13,062,528) rescinded from local funds, $8,917,082 added to dedicated taxes, ($13,477,130) rescinded from Medicaid payments, and ($1,641,862) rescinded from other funds);
Department of Human Services: $51,943,303 is added to local funds;
Department on Disability Services: ($407,234) is rescinded from local funds; and
Office of the Deputy Mayor for Health and Human Services: ($49,022) is rescinded from local funds.

The appropriation for Operations and Infrastructure is decreased by ($41,733,899) (including ($8,955,362) rescinded from local funds, ($1,940,945) rescinded from dedicated taxes, and ($30,837,593) rescinded from other funds), to be allocated as follows:
Alcoholic Beverage and Cannabis Administration: ($350,860) is rescinded from other funds;
Department of Buildings: ($4,902,828) is rescinded (including ($3,478,875) rescinded from local funds and ($1,423,953) rescinded from other funds);
Department of Energy and Environment: ($20,575,052) is rescinded (including ($2,018,431) rescinded from local funds and ($18,556,621) rescinded from other funds);
Department of For-Hire Vehicles: ($4,866,997) is rescinded (including ($2,627,835) rescinded from local funds and ($2,239,162) rescinded from other funds);
Department of Insurance, Securities, and Banking: ($4,003,003) is rescinded (including ($269,179) rescinded from local funds and ($3,706,824) rescinded from other funds);
Department of Licensing and Consumer Protection: ($2,616,051) is rescinded (including ($274,248) rescinded from local funds and ($2,341,803) rescinded from other funds);
Department of Motor Vehicles: ($3,954,348) is rescinded (including ($2,532,119) rescinded from local funds and ($1,422,229) rescinded from other funds;
Department of Public Works: $5,203,896 is added (including $5,226,425 added to local funds and ($22,529) rescinded from other funds);

District Department of Transportation: ($6,123,793) is rescinded (including ($6,048,793) rescinded from local funds and ($75,000) rescinded from other funds); provided, that all funds deposited, without regard to fiscal year, into the Tree Fund shall remain available for expenditure until September 30, 2025;
Office of the Deputy Mayor for Operations and Infrastructure: ($29,856) is rescinded from local funds;
Office of the People's Counsel: ($815,300) is rescinded (including ($116,689) from local funds and ($698,611) from other funds); and
Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority: $1,300,294 is added (including $3,241,239 added to local funds and ($1,940,945) rescinded from dedicated taxes).
The appropriation for Financing and Other is decreased by ($176,996,828) (including ($178,886,828) rescinded from local funds and $1,890,000 added to dedicated taxes), to be allocated as follows:
Convention Center Transfer: $214,000 is added to dedicated taxes;
District of Columbia Highway Transportation Fund: $1,676,000 is added to dedicated taxes;
Emergency Planning and Security Fund: $15,000,000 is added to local funds;
Repayment of Contingency Reserve Fund: $62,193,935 is added to local funds;
Repayment of Loans and Interest: ($68,097,926) is rescinded from local funds;
Settlements and Judgements: ($135,000) is rescinded from local funds; and
Workforce Investments Account: ($187,847,837) is rescinded from local funds.

The appropriation for Enterprise and Other Funds is decreased by ($43,057,573) (including ($1,829,049) rescinded from enterprise and other funds and ($41,228,524) rescinded from enterprise and other funds – dedicated taxes), to be allocated as follows:
Housing Production Trust Fund: ($858,473) is rescinded from enterprise and other funds – dedicated taxes;
Repayment of PILOT Financing: ($38,502,226) is rescinded from enterprise and other funds – dedicated taxes;
Tax Increment Financing Program: ($1,867,825) is rescinded from enterprise and other funds – dedicated taxes;
University of the District of Columbia: ($2,043,049) is rescinded from enterprise and other funds; and
Washington Convention and Sports Authority: $214,000 is added to enterprise and other funds.

codify:marginalia.display: Not Codified in the D.C. Code

section.heading: Universal Paid Leave Implementation Fund transfer amendment.

para.text: Section 8002(b) of the Designated Fund Transfer Act of 2022, effective September 21, 2022 (D.C. Law 24-167; 69 DCR 9223), is amended as follows:
Paragraph (1) is amended by striking the semicolon and inserting the phrase "; and" in its place.
Paragraph (2) is amended by striking the semicolon and inserting a period in its place
Paragraphs (3) and (4) are repealed.

section.heading: Healthy DC and Health Care Expansion Fund transfer amendment.

para.text: Section 15b(d) of the Hospital and Medical Services Corporation Regulatory Act of 1996, effective March 2, 2007 (D.C. Law 16-192; D.C. Official Code § 31-3514.02(d)), is amended by striking the phrase "fiscal years 2025, 2026," and inserting the phrase "fiscal years 2026," in its place.
This section shall apply as of September 18, 2024.
Section 210(c) of the Clean and Affordable Energy Act of 2008, effective October 22, 2008 (D.C. Law 17-250; D.C. Official Code § 8-1774.10(c)), is amended as follows:
Paragraph (16)(B) is amended by striking the phrase "at least $7 million" and inserting the phrase "at least $3.5 million" in its place.
Paragraph (25)(B) is amended to read as follows:
For Fiscal Year 2025, $34,416,329;

codify:insert.text: *NOTE: This section includes amendments by emergency legislation that will expire on November 16, 2025. To view the text of this section after the expiration of all emergency and temporary legislation, click this link: Permanent Version.*

section.heading: National, Lincoln, and Howard theaters grants.
section.text: Section 6d of the Commission on the Arts and Humanities Act, effective September 6, 2023 (D.C. Law 25-50; D.C. Official Code § 39-205.04), is amended by adding a new subsection (f) to read as follows:

para.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this section or the Grant Administration Act of 2013, effective December 24, 2013 (D.C. Law 20-61; D.C. Official Code § 1-328.11 et seq.), from the funds appropriated for the Large Capital Grants program, the Commission shall issue the following grants in Fiscal Year 2025:
$4 million to the National Theatre, for the acquisition of and repairs to the theater;
$500,000 to the Howard Theatre, for debt service payments related to renovations and improvements to the theater and operational expenses of the theater; and
$285,000 to the Lincoln Theatre, for repairs to and renovation of the theater.

Notwithstanding any provisions of law directing the deposit of revenue into, or limiting the use of funds in, the accounts listed in the following chart, the Chief Financial Officer shall transfer in Fiscal Year 2025 the following amounts from the certified fund balances and other revenue in the identified accounts to the General Fund of the District of Columbia:

tr.td: Historic Landmark and Historic District Filing Fees
Real Estate Guaranty and Education Fund
H St Retail Priority Area Grant Fund
State Athletic Acts Program and Office Fund
Individual Insurance Market Affordability and Stability
Nursing Homes Quality of Care Fund
DC Circulator Fund - NPS Mall Route
Vision Zero Pedestrian and Bicycle Safety
Underground Storage Tank Fines and Fees

para.text: Notwithstanding any provision of law directing the deposit of revenue, the Chief Financial Officer shall transfer in Fiscal Year 2025 the following amounts of local revenue in the General Fund of the District of Columbia to the accounts listed in the following chart:
The amounts identified in subsection (a) of this section shall be made available as set forth in the approved Fiscal Year 2026 Budget and Financial Plan.
The amounts identified in subsection (b) of this section shall be made available as set forth in the approved Fiscal Year 2025 Budget and Financial Plan, as revised by this act.

section.heading: Capital project funding rescissions and increases.
section.text: In Fiscal Year 2025, the capital project appropriations for Fiscal Year 2025 shall be increased and decreased as set forth in the following chart:

tr.td: 100574-KA0.LMC04C.5339A - BUS AND BUS FACILITY FORMULA PRO

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Chief Financial Officer as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), and shall remain in effect for no longer than 90 days, as provided for emergency acts of the Council of the District of Columbia in section 412(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 788; D.C. Official Code § 1-204.12(a)).
